titleStmt.title: St. Hillaries teares shed upon all professions from the judge to the petty fogger from the spruce dames of exchange to the durty walking fishmongers : from the coven-garden lady of iniquity to the turne-bal-streete-trull and indeed from the tower-staires to Westminster ferry : for want of a stirring midsomer terme this yeare of disasters, 1642 / written by one of his secretaries that had nothing else to doe.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Taylor. Cf. NUC-pre 1956.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
